cases.description: Score 0 - delirium unlikely, fully alert, no cognitive errors
cases.source: Bellelli G, et al. Age and Ageing. 2014;43(4):496-502. All 0 = Delirium Unlikely.

cases.description: Score 1 - possible cognitive impairment, 1 AMT4 mistake only
cases.source: Bellelli G, et al. Age and Ageing. 2014. AMT4 1 mistake (+1) = 1.

cases.description: Score 3 - possible cognitive impairment, AMT4 errors and attention deficit
cases.source: Bellelli G, et al. Age and Ageing. 2014. AMT4 1 mistake (+1) + Attention <7 months (+1) + Alertness mild sleepiness (0) = 2. Wait: AMT4 >=2 mistakes (+2) + Attention <7 months (+1) = 3.

cases.description: Score 4 - likely delirium, clearly abnormal alertness
cases.source: Bellelli G, et al. Age and Ageing. 2014. Clearly abnormal alertness (+4) = 4.

cases.description: Maximum score 12 - all domains maximally impaired
cases.source: Bellelli G, et al. Age and Ageing. 2014. Alertness (+4) + AMT4 (+2) + Attention (+2) + Acute change (+4) = 12.
